name: Name
swarm-special: Can only be damaged by flamethrowers and mutations
selection-description: Which one were you looking for?
selection-instructions: Type your response in the channel you called the command. This message was PMed to you to hide the choices (i.e. the monster name).
carkthreat-description: Draws a random threat against the Ark.
cartifact-description:
Draws a random artifact from the MYZ core rulebook. Available additional sources are (combine one or more):
‚Ä¢ `myz` ‚Äì Mutant: Year Zero (default if none are specified)
‚Ä¢ `gla` ‚Äì Mutant: GenLab Alpha
‚Ä¢ `mek` ‚Äì Mutant: Mechatron
‚Ä¢ `ely` ‚Äì Mutant: Elysium
‚Ä¢ `astra` ‚Äì Mutant: Ad Astra
Metaplot items are removed by default. Use `meta` to add them to the stack.
Use `all` to pick from all book sources (including metaplot items).
cartifact-not-found: I'm sorry, no artifact was found within this unknown package!
cattack-description: Rolls a random attack from a monster.
cattack-moredescriptions:
`‚Ä¢ `game` ‚Äì Specifies the game you are using. Can be omitted.
‚Ä¢ `name` ‚Äì Specifies the monster you want to fetch.
‚Ä¢ `number` ‚Äì Specifies the desired attack instead of choosing a random one.
‚Ä¢ `-private|-p` ‚Äì Sends the message in a private DM.

‚Ä¢ Click ‚öîÔ∏è to roll the dice of the attack.
‚Ä¢ Click ‚ò†Ô∏è to roll the critical (some attacks have fixed crits, others are random).
‚Ä¢ Click ‚ùå to stop the reaction menu.
ccast-description: Cast a spell. Use the `-mishap` parameter if you want a specific mishap.
cchangelog-description: Prints a link to the official changelog.
cchangelog-text: You can check out the latest patch notes at
ccharacter-moredescriptions:
‚Ä¢ `sheet` ‚Äì Prints the embed sheet of your currently active character.
‚Ä¢ `list` ‚Äì Lists your characters.
‚Ä¢ `update [-v]` ‚Äì Updates your current character sheet. The `-v` argument displays an embed sheet.
‚Ä¢ `delete` ‚Äì Deletes a character.
ccharacter-active-changed-to: Your active character was changed to
ccharacter-delete-confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete **{character_name}**? *(Reply with yes/no)*
ccharacter-cannot-find-url: Cannot find the URL of the active character.
ccolony-description: Generates a colonized planet for the Alien RPG.
ccolony-moredescriptions:
‚Ä¢ `name` - Specifies a custom colony name.
‚Ä¢ `type` - Specifies the planet type (default is "rocky").
> Choices: rocky, icy, gasgiant, gasgiant-moon, asteroid-belt
‚Ä¢ `location` - Specifies if the colony belongs to the independent `core` system colonies or the american or anglo-japanese `arm`.
ccontact-description: Rolls dice for an Elysium Contact and checks for any Backlash.
ccrit-description: Rolls for a random critical injury. Use the `-private` argument to send the result in a DM.
ccrit-moredescriptions:
There are several arguments you can use with this command in any order:
‚Ä¢ `game` ‚Äì Specifies the game you are using. Can be omitted if you set it with `!setconf game [default game]`.
> Choices: `myz`, `fbl`, `tales`, `coriolis`, `alien`, `vaesen`, `t2k`.
‚Ä¢ `table` ‚Äì Specifies the table you want from this game. See below for possible options *(default is "damage")*.
‚Ä¢ `numeric` ‚Äì Specifies a fixed reference.
‚Ä¢ `-private|-p` ‚Äì Sends the result in a DM.
‚Ä¢ `-lucky|-ly <rank>` ‚Äì *Lucky* talent: On rank `1`, rolls twice and takes the lowest. On `2`, rolls twice and takes the lowest inverted. On `3`, takes the first critical injury (#11).

‚Ä¢ `dmg` | `damage` : Critical injuries from damage.
‚Ä¢ `h` | `horror` : The *Forbidden Lands* Horror traumas, adapted for MYZ.
‚Ä¢ `nt` | `nontypical` : Critical injury for non-typical damage.
‚Ä¢ `p` | `pushed` : Critical injury for pushed damage (none).

‚Ä¢ `sl` | `slash` : Critical injuries due to Slash wounds.
‚Ä¢ `bl` | `blunt` : Critical injuries due to Blunt force.
‚Ä¢ `st` | `stab` : Critical injuries due to Stab wounds.
‚Ä¢ `h` | `horror` : Horror traumas.
‚Ä¢ `nt` | `nontypical` : Critical injury for non-typical damage.
‚Ä¢ `p` | `pushed` : Critical injury for pushed damage (none).
‚Ä¢ Add `-lucky [rank]` instead of the fixed reference to use the talent (rank is optional, default is 1).

‚Ä¢ `dmg` | `damage` : Critical injuries from damage.
‚Ä¢ `s`, `synth` | `synthetic` : Critical injuries on Synthetics and Androids.
‚Ä¢ `x` | `xeno` : Critical injuries for Xenomorphs.
‚Ä¢ `m` | `mental` : Permanent mental traumas.

‚Ä¢ `dmg` | `damage` : Critical injuries from damage.
‚Ä¢ `at` | `atypical` : Critical injury for atypical damage.

‚Ä¢ `dmg` | `damage` : Physical critical injuries.
‚Ä¢ `m` | `mental` : Mental critical injuries.
ccrit-too-many-arguments: You typed too many arguments! See `help crit` for the correct usage.
ccrit-no-table-for-game: There is no critical table for the {game} roleplaying game in my database.
ccrit-table-not-found: There is no `{type}` critical table for
ccrit-lethality-start: This critical injury is **LETHAL** and must be HEALED

Rolls for a random critical injury.
Type `help crit` for more details.

Type `help crit` for more details.
ccritmyz-description:
Rolls for a random critical injury.
Type `help crit` for more details.
ccritvaesen-description:
Rolls for a random critical injury.
Type `help crit` for more details.
cdemon-description:
Generates a random demon according to the tables found in the *Forbidden Lands - Gamemaster's Guide*.
Note: all bonuses from the demon's abilities are not computed into its stats/armor/skills.
Note: the attacks output is not optimal on a small screen (smartphone).
cdrawinit-description:
Draws one or more initiative cards. The deck is specific to each Discord server.

__Parameter__
‚Ä¢ `[speed]` ‚Äì Number of initiative cards to draw. Default: 1.

__Arguments__
‚Ä¢ `[-haste <value>]` ‚Äì Draws more initiative cards and keeps the best one. The other are shuffled back into the deck before others draw their cards. Use this for special talents like *Lightning Fast*. Default: 1.
‚Ä¢ `[-shuffle]` ‚Äì Resets the deck. *(Which is probably needed at the beginning of every new encounter.)*
cdrawinit-deck-too-small: The size of the *Initiative* deck is too small.
cdrawinit-shuffled: Shuffled a new deck of *Initiative* cards.
cdrawinit-hastepool: Shuffled back into the deck because of haste
cdrawmutation-description:
Draws a random mutation from the MYZ core rulebook. Available additional sources are:
‚Ä¢ `gla` ‚Äì Adds *Mutant: GenLab Alpha* mutations
‚Ä¢ `zc2` ‚Äì Adds *Zone Compendium 2: Dead Blue Sea* mutations
‚Ä¢ `zc5` ‚Äì Adds *Zone Compendium 5: Hotel Imperator* mutations
‚Ä¢ `psi` ‚Äì Draws only from Psionic/mental mutations
Use `all` to pick from all book sources.
cembed-description: Creates an embed message. Both the title and the description of the embed are mandatory and must be separated by an `|` horizontal bar character.
cferal-description: Rolls dice for a GenLab Alpha Animal Power and checks for any Feral Effect.
chelp-description: Lists all available commands. If a command's name is specified, prints more info about that specific command instead.
chelp-command-list-text:
Type `{prefix}help -list` to get the list of all commands.
Type `{prefix}help [command name]` to get info on a specific command.
chelp-sent-dm: I've sent you a DM with all my commands!
chelp-dm-error: It seems like I can't DM you! Do you have DMs disabled?
cimportcharacter-description: Imports a character sheet. The `-v` argument displays an embed sheet.
cinit-description: Initiative tracker. Inspired from the [D&D Avrae Discord bot](https://avrae.io/).
cinit-moredescriptions:
**add** ‚Äì Adds a generic combatant to the initiative order.
**attack** ‚Äì Inflicts damage to another combatant.
**begin** ‚Äì Begins combat in the channel the command is invoked.
**edit** ‚Äì Edits the options of a combatant.
**end** ‚Äì Ends combat in the channel.
**hp** ‚Äì Modifies the HP of a combatant.
**join** ‚Äì Adds the current player to combat.
**list** ‚Äì Lists the combatants.
**madd** ‚Äì Adds a monster to combat.
**meta** ‚Äì Changes the settings of the active combat.
**move** ‚Äì Moves to a certain initiative.
**next** ‚Äì Moves to the next turn in initiative order.
**note** ‚Äì Attaches a note to a combatant.
**prev** ‚Äì Moves to the previous turn in initiative order.
**remove** ‚Äì Removes a combatant or group from the combat.
**skipround** ‚Äì Skips one or more rounds of initiative.
**status** ‚Äì Gets the status of a combatant or group.
Type `init help <subcommand>` for more info on a subcommand.
cinit-subdescriptions: `begin [-name <name>] [-game <game>] [-turnnotif]`

Begins combat in the channel the command is invoked.

__Parameters__
‚Ä¢ `-name <name>` ‚Äì Sets a name for the combat instance.
‚Ä¢ `-game <game>` ‚Äì Sets the game. If omitted, use the default set in the server's configuration.
‚Ä¢ `-turnnotif` ‚Äì Toggles the notification of the controller of the next combatant in initiative.
`add <name> [options...]`

Adds a generic combatant to the initiative order.
Generic combatants have 3 life, no armor, and speed 1.
If you are adding monsters to combat, you can use `init madd` instead.

__Options__
‚Ä¢ `-p <value1 value2 ...>` ‚Äì Places combatant at the given initiative, instead of drawing.
‚Ä¢ `-controller <mention>` ‚Äì Pings a different person on turn.
‚Ä¢ `-group|-g <name>` ‚Äì Adds the combatant to a group.
‚Ä¢ `-hp <value>` ‚Äì Sets starting HP. Default: 3.
‚Ä¢ `-ar <value>` ‚Äì Sets the combatant's armor. Default: 0.
‚Ä¢ `-speed <value>` ‚Äì Sets the combatant's speed (number of initiative cards to draw). Default: 1.
‚Ä¢ `-haste <value>` ‚Äì Draws more initiative cards and keeps the best one. The other are shuffled back into the deck before others draw their cards. Use this for special talents like *Lightning Fast*. Default: 1.
‚Ä¢ `-h` ‚Äì Hides life, AR and anything else.
`join [options...]`

Same as `init add`, but you don't need to specify a name. The command will use your displayed name on the server. The command will be used in future updates in combination with character sheets.

__Options__
‚Ä¢ `-p <value1 value2 ...>` ‚Äì Places combatant at the given initiative, instead of drawing.
‚Ä¢ `-controller <mention>` ‚Äì Pings a different person on turn.
‚Ä¢ `-group|-g <name>` ‚Äì Adds the combatant to a group.
‚Ä¢ `-hp <value>` ‚Äì Sets starting HP. Default: 3.
‚Ä¢ `-ar <value>` ‚Äì Sets the combatant's armor. Default: 0.
‚Ä¢ `-speed <value>` ‚Äì Sets the combatant's speed (number of initiative cards to draw). Default: 1.
‚Ä¢ `-haste <value>` ‚Äì Draws more initiative cards and keeps the best one. The other are shuffled back into the deck before others draw their cards. Use this for special talents like *Lightning Fast*. Default: 1.
‚Ä¢ `-h` ‚Äì Hides life, AR and anything else.
`madd <name> [-n <quantity>] [options...]`

Adds one or more monster combatant(s). Same as `init add`, but in addition you can specify a number of combatants with the `-n <quantity>` parameter.

__Options__
‚Ä¢ `-p <value1 value2 ...>` ‚Äì Places combatant at the given initiative, instead of drawing.
‚Ä¢ `-controller <mention>` ‚Äì Pings a different person on turn.
‚Ä¢ `-group|-g <name>` ‚Äì Adds the combatant to a group.
‚Ä¢ `-hp <value>` ‚Äì Sets starting HP. Default: 3.
‚Ä¢ `-ar <value>` ‚Äì Sets the combatant's armor. Default: 0.
‚Ä¢ `-speed <value>` ‚Äì Sets the combatant's speed (number of initiative cards to draw). Default: 1.
‚Ä¢ `-haste <value>` ‚Äì Draws more initiative cards and keeps the best one. The other are shuffled back into the deck before others draw their cards. Use this for special talents like *Lightning Fast*. Default: 1.
‚Ä¢ `-h` ‚Äì Hides life, AR and anything else.
`next|n`
Moves to the next turn in initiative order. It must be your turn or you must be the GM (the person who started combat) to use this command.
`previous|p`
Moves to the previous turn in initiative order.
`move|goto <target>`
Moves to a certain initiative. `target` can be either a number, to go to that initiative, or a name. If not supplied, goes to the first combatant that the user controls.
`skipround|skip`
Skips one or more rounds of initiative.
`meta`

Changes the settings of the active combat.

__Parameters__
‚Ä¢ `-name <name>` ‚Äì Sets a name for the combat instance.
‚Ä¢ `-game <game>` ‚Äì Sets the game. If omitted, use the default set in the server's configuration.
‚Ä¢ `-turnnotif` ‚Äì Toggles the notification of the controller of the next combatant in initiative.
`list|summary [-private]
Lists the combatants. The parameter `-private` sends the list in a private message.
`note <name> [note]`
Attaches a note to a combatant.
`edit <name> [options...]`

Edits the options of a combatant. This command uses the same options from `init add` with the addition of `-name` and `-max

__Options__
‚Ä¢ `-name <name>` ‚Äì Changes the combatant's name.
‚Ä¢ `-max <value>` ‚Äì Modifies the combatants' Max HP. Adds if starts with +/- or sets otherwise.
‚Ä¢ `-p <value1 value2 ...>` ‚Äì Places combatant at the given initiative, instead of drawing.
‚Ä¢ `-controller <mention>` ‚Äì Pings a different person on turn.
‚Ä¢ `-group|-g <name>` ‚Äì Adds the combatant to a group.
‚Ä¢ `-hp <value>` ‚Äì Sets starting HP. Default: 3.
‚Ä¢ `-ar <value>` ‚Äì Sets the combatant's armor. Default: 0.
‚Ä¢ `-speed <value>` ‚Äì Sets the combatant's speed (number of initiative cards to draw). Default: 1.
‚Ä¢ `-haste <value>` ‚Äì Draws more initiative cards and keeps the best one. The other are shuffled back into the deck before others draw their cards. Use this for special talents like *Lightning Fast*. Default: 1.
‚Ä¢ `-h` ‚Äì Hides life, AR and anything else.
`status <name> [-private]`
Gets the status of a combatant or group. The parameter `-private` sends a more detailed status in a private message to the controller of the combatant.
`hp <name> [value] [-max]`
Modifies the HP of a combatant. If the value is omitted, instead prints the details of the combatant. Use parameter `-max` if you want to set the Max HP value instead.
`attack|atk <damage> <[-t|-target] names...> [options...]`

Inflicts damage to another combatant and rolls their armor.

__Target__
‚Ä¢ `[-t|-target] <names...>` ‚Äì The target to inflict damage. If omitted, uses the current combattant. You can specify multiple targets by separating them with the `|` character. *E.g.: `-t Bob|Will|Smith`*

__Options__
‚Ä¢ `-ap [value]` Armor piercing. Default is halved, rounded up. If a value is specified, instead decrease the Armor Rating by this value.
‚Ä¢ `-ad` ‚Äì Armor doubled. *(E.g.: for Shotguns in Alien RPG.)*
‚Ä¢ `-ab|-bonus` ‚Äì Armor bonus (applied after all other modifications).
‚Ä¢ `-x|-degrade` ‚Äì Whether the armor should be degraded. If omitted, uses the default from the game set.
‚Ä¢ `-noar|-noarmor` ‚Äì Skips the armor roll.
‚Ä¢ `-h` ‚Äì Hides the armor roll.
`remove <name>`
Removes a combatant or group from the combat.
end [-force]
Ends combat in the channel. The parameter `-force` forces an init to end, in case it's erroring.
cinit-incorrect-usage: Incorrect usage. Use `{prefix}help init` for help.
cinit-combat-already-in-progress: Cannot start a new combat instance because there is already one in progress.
cinit-no-combatant-with-name: No combatant found with this name.
cinit-combat-scene-started: **Combat Scene Started:** Everyone draw the initiative!
cinit-hp-must-be-positive: You must pass in a positive nonzero HP with the `-hp` tag.
cinit-armor-must-be-positive: You must pass in a positive armor value with the `-ar` tag.
cinit-initiative-must-be-numbers: You must pass in numbers with the `-p` tag.
cinit-initiative-must-be-positive: You must pass in a positive nonzero initiative value with the `-p` tag.
cinit-added-to-initiative: was added to combat with initiative
cinit-indicate-monster-name: Please indicate a name for the monster.
cinit-start-combat-first: Please start combat with `{prefix}init next` first.
cinit-cant-change-initiative-on-turn: You cannot change a combatant's initiative on their own turn.
cinit-duplicate-name: There is already another combatant with the name
cinit-missing-name: You must pass in a name with the `-name` tag.
cinit-max-hp-minimum: Max HP must at least be 1.
cinit-combatant-blocked-all-damage: No damage were inflicted. **{combatant}**'s armor absorbed the totality.
cinit-cant-remove-in-own-turn: You cannot remove a combatant on their own turn.
cinit-cant-remove-last-combatant: You cannot remove a combatant if they are the only remaining combatant in this turn.
cinit-end-confirmation: **Are you sure you want to end combat?** *(reply with yes/no)*
cinit-timeout: Timed out waiting for a response or invalid response.
cinvite-description: Prints a link to invite Sebedius to your server.
cinvite-text: You can invite Sebedius to your server here
cjob-description: Generates a random job for the Alien RPG.
cjourney-description:
Performs a *Forbidden Lands* Journey.
With this command, you can **Create** a Journey with defined *Quarter Day*, *Season* and *Terrain* to display information about the roll modifiers and the available activities. Players can then use a reaction menu to choose their activity as a reminder for the GM.
You can also draw a random **Mishap** for a failed activity.
Weather effects and Mishaps tables for *The Bitter Reach* are also available.
cjourney-moredescriptions:
‚Ä¢ `create|c` or `-create|-c` ‚Äì Creates a Journey.
‚Ä¢ `mishap|m` or `-mishap|-m` ‚Äì Draws a random Journey mishap.
‚Ä¢ `help` ‚Äì Displays this help.

`[QUARTER_DAY]` ‚Äì Defines the current **Quarter of Day**. Available options are: `morning`, `day` *(default)*, `evening` and `night`.
‚Ä¢ `-quarter|-q|-d|-quarterday|-qd [search]` ‚Äì Prompts a menu to choose a **Quarter of Day** option, filtered by what you provided in the `[search]` parameter.
‚Ä¢ `[SEASON]` ‚Äì Defines the current **Season**. Available options are: `spring` *(default)*, `summer`, `autumn` and `winter`.
‚Ä¢ `-season|-s [search]` ‚Äì Prompts a menu.
‚Ä¢ `[TERRAIN]` ‚Äì Defines the current **Terrain** type. Available options are: `plains` *(default)*, `forest`, `dark_forest`, `hills`, `mountains`, `high_mountains`, `lake`, `river`, `ocean`, `marshlands`, `quagmire`, `ruins`, *(Bitter Reach)* `tundra`, `ice_cap`, `beneath_the_ice`, `ice_forest` and `sea_ice`.
‚Ä¢ `-terrain|-t [search]` ‚Äì Prompts a menu.
‚Ä¢ `...arguments` ‚Äì See other common arguments below.

Possible activities that have Mishaps: `leadTheWay`, `makeCamp`, `forage`, `hunt`, `fish`, `seaTravel`
*If no activity is specified, the bot prompts a menu to choose one (filtered by partial words you may have provided).*

‚Ä¢ `-fbr|-bitterreach|-snow|-ice` ‚Äì Uses *Forbidden Lands: The Bitter Reach* Mishaps tables and draws random *Bitter Reach* weather effects.
 ‚Ä¢ `-name|-title|-n <title>` ‚Äì Defines a title.
 ‚Ä¢ `-lang|-language|-lng <language_code>` ‚Äì Uses a different language. See `setconf` command for available options.
cjourney-generic-description: Choose an Activity and roll for `SURVIVAL`.
cjourney-movement-modifier-open:
On foot: 2 Hexagons / Quarter
On Horse-back: 3 Hexagons / Quarter
cjourney-movement-modifier-difficult:
On foot: 1 Hexagon / Quarter
On Horse-back: 1 Hexagon / Quarter
clegend-description: Generates a random legend according to the tables found in the *Forbidden Lands - Gamemaster's Guide*.
cmodule-description: Rolls dice for a Mechatron Module and checks for any Overheating.
cmonster-description: Gets a monster from the catalogs or generates a random monster according to the tables found in the *Zone Compendium 1: The Lair of the Saurians* if no argument is provided.
cmonster-moredescriptions:
‚Ä¢ `game` ‚Äì Specifies the game you are using. Can be omitted.
‚Ä¢ `name` ‚Äì Specifies the monster you want to fetch.
‚Ä¢ `-attack|-atk|-a [number]` ‚Äì Specifies that you also want to roll an attack. If a number is added, the bot will use that value instead of rolling a random attack (you can also type `<name> [number]` instead of the `-attack` argument).
‚Ä¢ `-private|-p` ‚Äì Sends the message in a private DM.
Reaction Menu (if an attack is called)

‚Ä¢ Click ‚öîÔ∏è to roll the dice of the attack.
‚Ä¢ Click ‚ò†Ô∏è to roll the critical (some attacks have fixed crits, others are random).
‚Ä¢ Click ‚ùå to stop the reaction menu.
cmutation-description: Rolls dice for a Mutation and checks for any Misfire.
cmyzpower-description: Rolls the dice for a MYZ power.
cpanic-description: Rolls for a random panic effect for the *ALIEN* roleplaying game. You must indicate your starting stress level.
cpanic-moredescriptions:
‚Ä¢ `-fixed|-f` ‚Äì Uses a fixed number instead (doesn't add a D6).
‚Ä¢ `-nerves|-n` ‚Äì Applies the *Nerves of Steel* talent (‚àí2 to the Panic roll).
‚Ä¢ `-min <value>` ‚Äì Adjusts a minimum threshold for multiple consecutive panic effects.
cpanic-interrupted-skill-roll-text: You will be forced to perform a specific action. If the Panic Roll was the result of a skill check for an action, the action is cancelled and immediately replaced by the forced panic action, even if you succeeded your roll.
cpanic-mental-trauma-reminder-title: End of Game Session: Roll for Permanent Mental Trauma
cpanic-mental-trauma-reminder-text: You must make an **EMPATHY** roll after the session. Roll for the attribute only, not using any skill. If the roll *succeeds*, you develop a permanent mental trauma of some kind. Roll a D6 and consult the table on page 161.
cplanet-description: Generates an uncolonized planet for the Alien RPG.
cplanet-moredescriptions:
‚Ä¢ `name` - Specifies a custom planet name.
‚Ä¢ `type` - Specifies the planet type (default is "rocky").
> Choices: rocky, icy, gasgiant, gasgiant-moon, asteroid-belt
cprefix-description: Gets the prefixes for this server. Sets a new one with the option `set`.
cresource-invalid-dice: I don't understand this resource die. Use `d6`, `d8`, `d10` or `d12`
cresource-too-many-dice: Can't roll that, too many dice!
cresource-decreased-text: One unit is used. The Resource Die is decreased one step to a
croll-description: Rolls dice for any Year Zero roleplaying game.
croll-moredescriptions:
This argument is used to specify the skin of the rolled dice. Can be omitted if you set it with `!setconf game [default game]` or if you use one of the shortcut commands.
 Choices: `myz`, `fbl`, `tales`, `coriolis`, `alien`, `vaesen`, `t2k`.

`roll d6|d66|d666` ‚Äì Rolls a D6, D66, or D666.
`roll XdY¬±Z` ‚Äì Rolls X dice of range Y, modified by Z.
`roll init` ‚Äì Rolls initiative (one D6).

Use a number in any combinations with these letters:
‚Ä¢ `b` ‚Äì Base dice (attributes)
‚Ä¢ `s` ‚Äì Skill dice (or Stress dice for *Alien RPG*)
‚Ä¢ `n` ‚Äì Negative dice (*MYZ* and *FBL* only)
‚Ä¢ `g` ‚Äì Gear dice (*MYZ* and *FBL* only)
‚Ä¢ `d` ‚Äì Generic dice (or Ammo dice for *Twilight 2000*)
‚Ä¢ `a` ‚Äì Ammo dice (*Twilight 2000* only)
‚Ä¢ `a8` ‚Äì D8 Artifact die (see *FBL*)
‚Ä¢ `a10` ‚Äì D10 Artifact die (see *FBL*)
‚Ä¢ `a12` ‚Äì D12 Artifact die (see *FBL*)

*Example:* `roll 5b 3s 2g`

Additional options for the roll:
`-name|-n|-#|# <name>` : Defines a name for the roll.
`-push|-p <number>` : Changes the maximum number of allowed pushes.
`-fullauto|-fa|-f` : "Full-auto", unlimited number of pushes (max 10).
`-mod <¬±X>`: Applies a difficulty modifier of `+X` or `-X` to the roll.
`-pride` : Adds a D12 Artifact Die to the roll.
`-nerves` : Applies the talent *Nerves of Steel* (Alien RPG).
`-minpanic <value>` : Adjusts a minimum treshold for multiple consecutive panic effects (Alien RPG).
`-lang <language_code>` : Changes the desired language.

To push the roll, click the üîÑ reaction icon under the message. The push option for the dice pool roll is available for 2 minutes. Only the user who initially rolled the dice can push them.
To clear the reaction menu, click the ‚ùå reaction icon.
Coriolis has more push options: üôè (Praying the Icons, +1D) and üïå (in a chapel, +2D).
Max 42 dice can be rolled at once. If you try to roll more, it won't happen.

The following commands are shortcuts if you don't want to specify the [game] parameter each time.
`rm` ‚Äì Rolls *Mutant: Year Zero* dice.
`rf` ‚Äì Rolls *Forbidden Lands* dice.
`rt` ‚Äì Rolls *Tales From The Loop* dice.
`rc` ‚Äì Rolls *Coriolis* dice.
`ra` ‚Äì Rolls *Alien RPG* dice.
`rv` ‚Äì Rolls *Vaesen* dice.
`rw` ‚Äì Rolls *Twilight 2000 4E* dice.
croll-invalid-syntax: I don't understand this syntax. Type `{will_be_replaced}help roll` for details on the proper usage.
croll-no-dice: Can't roll a null number of dice!
crollalien-description:
Rolls dice for the *ALIEN* roleplaying game.
Type `help roll` for more details.
crollcoriolis-description:
Rolls dice for the *Coriolis* roleplaying game.
Type `help roll` for more details.
crollfbl-description:
Rolls dice for the *Forbidden Lands* roleplaying game.
Type `help roll` for more details.
crollmyz-description:
Rolls dice for the *Mutant: Year Zero* roleplaying game.
Type `help roll` for more details.
crollt2k-description:
Rolls dice for the *Twilight 2000* roleplaying game.
Type `help roll` for more details.
crollt2k-moredescriptions:
Use any combinations of the following.
__Attribute or skill dice__:
‚Ä¢ `d12 | a` ‚Äì Rolls a D12
‚Ä¢ `d10 | b` ‚Äì Rolls a D10
‚Ä¢ `d8 | c` ‚Äì Rolls a D8
‚Ä¢ `d6 | d` ‚Äì Rolls a D6
__Other__:
‚Ä¢ `Xg` ‚Äì Rolls X ammo dice
‚Ä¢ `Xd | Xb | Xs` ‚Äì Rolls X base (D6) dice
Type `help roll` for the list of available arguments.
This is based on the alpha version of the rules.

Rolls dice for the *Tales From the Loop* roleplaying game.
Type `help roll` for more details.
crollvaesen-description:
Rolls dice for the *Vaesen* roleplaying game.
Type `help roll` for more details.
csetconf-description:
Sets the bot's configuration for this server. If you omit the new value, it returns the current value. See possible parameters:
`prefix [new value]` ‚Äì Gets or sets the prefix for triggering the commands of this bot.
`game [new value]` ‚Äì Gets or sets the default game used (for dice skins and critical injuries tables). Options are `myz`, `fbl`, `tales`, `coriolis`, `alien`, `vaesen`, `t2k`.
`lang [new value]` ‚Äì Gets or sets the default language. See Readme for details.
csetconf-only-admin: This command is only available for members with the ADMINISTRATOR role.
csetconf-prefix: My prefix has been set to
csetconf-game: The default game has been set to
csetconf-language: The default language has been set to
csetconf-invalid-value: The value you typed for **{will_be_replaced}** is unsupported.
csetconf-cannot-get-value: Impossible to get the value from the **{will_be_replaced}** parameter.
cstar-description: Generates a Star sector for the Alien RPG.
cstar-prolog:
New star system discovered.
Preliminary survey data:
csupply-invalid-roll: This Supply Roll is not possible. Try
csupply-exhausted-text: The consumable is fully depleted.	Rating:
czonesector-moredescriptions:
‚Ä¢ `-rot|-rotlevel <0-3>` ‚Äì Sets the Rot Level between 0 and 3.
‚Ä¢ `-threats|-t <0-5>` ‚Äì Sets or modifies (if prefixing with ¬±) the number of Threats to draw between 0 (none) and 5.
‚Ä¢ `-threatlevel|-lvl <0-10>` ‚Äì Sets or modifies (if ¬±) the Threat Level between 0 (none) and 10.
‚Ä¢ `-night|-dark` ‚Äì Adds +3 to the Threat Level.
‚Ä¢ `-ruin|-r` ‚Äì Forces the placement of a large ruin.
‚Ä¢ `-lang|-language|-lng <language_code>` ‚Äì Uses a different language. See `setconf` command for available options.
‚Ä¢ `-hide|-private|-h` ‚Äì Hides most information behind several spoiler tags.
bot-user-muted: You have been muted and cannot use my commands.
bot-server-blacklisted: This server has been blacklisted and cannot use my commands.
bot-cant-execute-in-dm: I can't execute that command inside DMs!
bot-cooldown: Please wait {will_be_replaced} second(s) before reusing the command
bot-error-no-element-selected: There is no element to select.
bot-error-command-execution: There was an error trying to execute that command!
bot-missing-permissions:
**Missing Permissions!**
The bot does not have sufficient permission in this channel and will not work properly. Check the Readme (`{prefix}help`) for the list of required permissions. Check the wiki for more troubleshooting.
